page.title: 01BETWEEN 2 N'UMBRIAN VILLAGES
page.content: This block consists of scrub upland and woodland with marginal farming. The woodland is usually coniferous plantatious, but Ford Moss Wood is relict scots pine woodland. Ford Moss is an area of special scientific interest under the care of the Northumbrian Wildlife Trust. the farms are 4-600 acres, well cared for and the stock is store cattle and sheep. The cereal crops are mainly wheat. There is one public house which serves Ford Village which is in the next block to this. There are remains (in ruins) of a coal mine at Ford Moss, long since abandoned when the dirft mines flooded due to drainage water from the moss.
